page.title: 04Transport
page.content: The refuse vehicle collects the household waste once a week on Tuesday. It is taken to the dump at Bunny Lane, Romsey, grid ref 358248. Fewer farm vehicles pass along the road to E.Dean because the farmer has built his own road to connect his farmland without the danger of the level crossing at grid ref. 280267. We have a bus service which passes through the village regularly 3 or 4 times a day. Most people travel by car to Romsey or by bicycle around the village. There are two garages where you can have your car serviced and repaired. They both sell petrol. The railway line goes through the village but the station is at Dunbridge, grid ref. 318262.
